intro: Cousinia subzevarensis, commonly known as the Zevaren's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. It produces small, yellowish to pinkish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Cousinia subzevarensis is often found in steppe and desert steppe habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
